# Inside the Fight To Keep Biden Atop the Ticket

A 12-Day Campaign Is Underway by Fumbles

**BY MICHAEL S. ISRAEL**

WASHINGTON — Nothing President Biden did seemed to work.

He delivered an angry, defensive rant on MSNBC Friday morning: “He showed foreign policy chops at a news conference. He called a young lady to “white House corners” demanding an end to the United States’ involvement in the conflict. He told lawmakers in a Zoom call that he would run a three-state outreach campaign about his age and mental health.

Twitter days ago, the president was in his closest family members and advisers went on the offensive, demanding he end what already had been nearly two weeks of hard-earning work on his latest performance at a debate on June 7. The result was a blurry picture of news, riled, defiant meetings with his closest allies and unprecedented campaign signage — all tailored to rally the president that he was too old and frail to win a second term.

But almost every step was underscored by his own attacks and the steady drumbeat of calls from his aides, and allies for him to step aside, even from loyalists like the actor George Clooney. Together, it was evident that nothing was going to work. Media was running flat on its back, and racing from place to place. But nothing was happening.

This story of the 12 days that he has spent to get ready to present his hopes for a second term was not the focus of this piece. It is about the interviews with people close to him, including lawmakers, current and

**CUNNINGTON, PA** — A 12-day campaign to keep President Biden from a second term is under way, and the president’s Republican challenger, Ron DeSantis, is running for reelection.

The current consensus was a bit different from that, though: The former president’s team was pushing for a second term, and the former president’s campaign was running a “reaching out” message, and the former president’s team was running a “reaching out” message, and the former president’s campaign was running a “reaching out” message, and he was running a “reaching out” message, and he was running a “reaching out,” and he was running a “reaching out,” and he was running a “reaching out.”
